task.Question: On June 6, 2023, an article by Carolyn Collins Petersen was published in Universe Today. This article mentions a team that produced a paper about their observations, linked at the bottom of the article. Find this paper. Under what NASA award number was the work performed by R. G. Arendt supported by?

Annotator Metadata.Steps:
1. Google "June 6, 2023 Carolyn Collins Petersen Universe Today"
2. Find the relevant link to the scientific paper and follow that link
3. Open the PDF. 
4. Search for NASA award number
Annotator Metadata.Tools:
1. Web browser
2. Search engine
3. Access to academic journal websites

steps.content: On June 6, 2023, an article by Carolyn Collins Petersen was published in Universe Today. This article mentions a team that produced a paper about their observations, linked at the bottom of the article. Find this paper. Under what NASA award number was the work performed by R. G. Arendt supported by?

plan: Search for the article by Carolyn Collins Petersen published on June 6, 2023, in Universe Today.
Locate the section of the article that mentions the team and their paper, and find the link to the paper.
Access the linked paper to gather information about the NASA award number related to R. G. Arendt's work.

given_facts: An article by Carolyn Collins Petersen was published on June 6, 2023, in Universe Today.
The article mentions a team that produced a paper about their observations.
R. G. Arendt is mentioned in relation to the work supported by a NASA award.
facts_to_lookup: The paper mentioned in the article by Carolyn Collins Petersen.
The NASA award number under which R. G. Arendt's work was supported.

steps.query: June 6 2023 article Carolyn Collins Petersen site:universetoday.com
June 6 2023 article Carolyn Collins Petersen site:universetoday.com

serp.title: Author: Carolyn Collins Petersen
serp.content: Oct 14, 2024 — Astronomers found a surprisingly Milky Way-like galaxy that existed more than 13 billion years ago. That was a time when the Universe was really just an infant.

serp.title: Author: Carolyn Collins Petersen
serp.content: Aug 10, 2024 — The amazing Gaia mission to chart stars in the Milky Way Galaxy is also an expert asteroid hunter. Now, astronomers are reporting its success at ...

serp.title: About Carolyn Collins Petersen - TheSpaceWriter.com
serp.content: Carolyn Collins Petersen is an award-winning science writer with six books, 40 documentary scripts, and countless magazine articles to her credit.

serp.title: Astronomy 101 by Carolyn Collins Petersen (Ebook)
serp.content: From the Big Bang and nebulae to the Milky Way and Sir Isaac Newton, this celestial primer is packed with hundreds of entertaining astronomy facts, charts, and ...

serp.title: 6/1/2023 - @universetoday - by Carolyn Collins Petersen
serp.content: by Carolyn Collins Petersen (. @spacewriter. ): You Can Detect Tsunamis as They Push the Atmosphere Around. From universetoday.com · 6:42 PM ...

steps.query: NASA award number R. G. Arendt site:universetoday.com
NASA award number R. G. Arendt site:universetoday.com
R. G. Arendt NASA award number paper June 2023
R. G. Arendt NASA award number paper June 2023

serp.title: The Population of the Galactic Center Filaments - IOPscience
serp.content: by F Yusef-Zadeh · 2023 · Cited by 17 — Richard.G.Arendt@nasa.gov · mark.wardle@mq.edu.au · ian.heywood@physics ... Work by R.G.A. was supported by NASA under award number 80GSFC21M0002.

serp.title: Bio - Richard G Arendt
serp.content: Richard G Arendt's Contact Card & Information. Email: richard.g.arendt@nasa.gov. Phone: 301.286.8607. Org Code: 665. Address: NASA/GSFC Mail Code 665. Greenbelt ...

serp.title: (PDF) The Population of the Galactic Center Filaments
serp.content: We have examined the distribution of the position angle (PA) of the Galactic center filaments with lengths L > 66″ and <66″ as well as their length ...

serp.title: population of Galactic Centre filaments – III. Candidate radio ...
serp.content: by F Yusef-Zadeh · 2022 · Cited by 9 — We have selected a sample of 57 radio sources, mainly compact objects, in the MeerKAT mosaic image that appear to be associated with NRFs.

serp.title: Mysterious dashes revealed in Milky Way's center
serp.content: 2 Jun 2023 — An international team of astrophysicists has discovered something wholly new, hidden in the center of the Milky Way galaxy.

steps.fact_description: NASA award number under which R. G. Arendt's work was supported
steps.quote_with_fact: Work by R.G.A. was supported by NASA under award number 80GSFC21M0002.

steps.overview: Identified the NASA award number for R. G. Arendt's work.
